clinical_study.brief_title: Safety of Bosentan in Type II Diabetic Patients
clinical_study.official_title: Masked, Placebo Controlled, Phase I Trial to Assess the Safety of Bosentan 5 mg/ml Ophthalmic Eyewash in Type II Diabetic Patients

collaborator.agency: Instituto Universitario de Oftalmobiología Aplicada (Institute of Applied Ophthalmobiology) - IOBA

brief_summary.textblock: This study evaluates the safety of topical Bosentan in Type II Diabetes patients

detailed_description.textblock: The study is a Phase I, masked, placebo controlled clinical trial to assess safety of topical Bosentan in Type II Diabetes patients with no diabetes retinopathy

clinical_study.why_stopped: Covid 19 general restrictions in Spain - Will eventually be resumed

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: 1 Eye receives placebo, the other eye receives study drug. Eye elections is randomized
study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)
study_design_info.masking_description: Placebo and Study Drug have the same physical characteristics, labeling and packaging

primary_outcome.description: Presence of epitheliopathy in the cornea or conjunctiva

secondary_outcome.description: Presence of ocular discomfort assessed with Ocular Surface Disease Index (OSDI) questionnaire
Presence of any sign of clinically significant inflammation at anterior segment

arm_group.description: The patient will receive investigational product in one eye and placebo in the other eye. The allocation of treatment / placebo is masked and randomized
The patient will receive investigational product in one eye and placebo in the other eye. The allocation of treatment / placebo is masked and randomized

intervention.description: Ophthalmic eyedrop with the exact same excipient of the drug arm without the active compound

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Signed informed consent;
- Type II Diabetes Mellitus;
- 18 or more years old
Exclusion Criteria:
- Pregnant or breastfeeding Women
- Known allergy or intolerance to investigational product or any of its excipients
- Severe corneal abnormalities
- Any relevant ocular / ophthalmic pathology that may put study results at risk in the opinion of Principal Investigator
- Any sign or symptom of Diabetes Retinopathy
- Any ocular surgery in the 6 previous months to study inclusion
- Uncontrolled diabetes in the previous 3 months to inclusion or HbA1c levels ≥ 9% at baseline.
- Oxford Scale or OSDI scores compatible with study failure at inclusion visit. (Oxford ≥ 5 or OSTDI ≥ 13)
- Previous hepatopathy history or signs of hepatopathy at baseline.
- Contact lens use
- Actual treatment with the commercially available presentation
